title: Montgomery, Alabama
summary: Montgomery is the capital city of the U.S. state of Alabama and the county seat of Montgomery County.[5] Named for Richard Montgomery, it stands beside the Alabama River, on the coastal Plain of the Gulf of Mexico. In the 2020 Census, Montgomery's population was 200,603.[6] It is the third most populous city in Alabama, after Birmingham and Huntsville, and is the 119th most populous in the United States. The Montgomery Metropolitan Statistical Area's population in 2020 was 386,047;[4] it is the fourth largest in the state and 142nd among United States metropolitan areas.[7]
